statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ -6 \\ -5 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ -2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 5 \\ 10 \\ -10 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 4 \\ 6 \\ 0 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ -6 \\ -5 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ -2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 5 \\ 10 \\ -10 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 4 \\ 6 \\ 0 \end{array}\right].
